list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: The cat jumped from the roof and reached the ground in two leaps.

list_ex_of_english: Loreen enters playing a low sustained tone that leaps a sixth to descend by step.
The theory and design of integrated circuits has moved forward in leaps and bounds in recent years.
The last essay in the collection leaps from the seventeenth to the twentieth century, to the new medium of the film.
Instead, what is presented is a brief overview of the most significant historical developments that, at times, leaps over centuries.
He leapt up, stuck the text under some papers, and greeted me with some irritation.
While forensic science had leapt ahead on the coattails of new laboratory instrumentation and techniques, dactyloscopy had remained relatively stagnant.
As in the three-voice works already cited, this voice has occasional wide leaps.
Both this and the cabaletta have a jagged melodic contour, alternating stepwise motion with leaps from chest to head register.
